Class JwtUtil

java.lang.Object
com.atu.green_global_initiative_api.security.JwtUtil
@Component public class JwtUtil extends Object
Utility class that handles operations related to JWT (JSON Web Token), such as generating, extracting information, and validating tokens. The class interacts with the JWT library to create secure tokens and verify their validity.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    JwtUtil(org.springframework.core.env.Environment env)
    Constructor that initializes the JwtUtil with the secret key from environment.

  • Constructor Details

    • JwtUtil

      public JwtUtil(org.springframework.core.env.Environment env)
      Constructor that initializes the JwtUtil with the secret key from environment.
      Parameters:
      env - the Environment object to fetch the secret key property.

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(UserDetailsDto userDetailsDto) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates a JWT token for the provided user details. The token contains information such as user ID, first name, last name, email, and admin status. The token is signed using the secret key and has an expiration of 10 hours.
      Parameters:
      userDetailsDto - the user details to be included in the token.
      Returns:
      a signed JWT token as a string.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is an error during token generation.

    • extractEmail

      public String extractEmail(String token)
      Extracts the email from the given JWT token. The email is retrieved from the claims of the token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token from which the email is to be extracted.
      Returns:
      the email associated with the JWT token.

    • validateToken

      public boolean validateToken(String token, UserDetailsDto userDetailsDto)
      Validates the JWT token by checking if the token is valid for the given user details. It checks that the username (email) in the token matches the provided user details and verifies that the token is not expired.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to be validated.
      userDetailsDto - the user details to compare with the token's email.
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid for the user and not expired, false otherwise.
